When it didn't getting problems resolved could be difficult since Grandma wasn't always willing to head out to the local Genus bar.  With this feature, the bar come to her.  Kidding aside, it positions this as the gift device of choice for anyone who might feel threatened with alternative tablets.Now for some specifics about this device: - The Ads supported version - They never get in the way.  As with previous versions, for me it is worth saving some money. - Display:  The display is outstanding!  Even better than the previous version, clear and bright without making everything look like a comic book and shows up well in sunlight without having to turn the display way up (which means the battery won't drain quickly). - Usability:  I've grown to prefer the Kindle interface, compared to the iPad or "Native" android tablets. The Kindle prominently displays apps used most recently and the ones I just installed in a side scrolling "Carousel". Other apps are just a few taps away. That's great for me and greater still for my young daughter ssince there's no hunting for the things I'm likely to want the most. The iPhone and other Androids I've seen do it the other way around. - First use: First use was very straightforward. I liked that it knew my name without me having to tell it. First thing it did, after greeting me (by name) was ask for my WiFi password. Once I logged it, it already knew about the apps, music, books, and videos I am using on my other Kindle devices.  I realize iPad does something similar. However, having used both, I feel the Kindle is easier. -On the business side, the built-in office software is handy and saves me from having to buy it outright.  I can access my email accounts, including those in an Exchange server, with no problems. Attachments, including .PDF files, Word documents, and Excel spreadsheets can all be read with no problems. - Back to the fun stuff, YouTube, Netflix, and SmugMug videos stream flawlessly. Pandora provides music without a hitch. It connects to Bluetooth devices quickly and easily. - The Camera:  The front facing camera, designed for video conferencing, provides a clear image while the screen provides a vivid image of the person at the other end. We ran some side-by-side tests with our iPad 3 and the Fire always performed better. They've added a rear-facing camera which I probably won't use for taking snapshots (that's what an iPhone is for) and will for Skype sessions where I want to show my surrounds. - The Missing Charger: Isn't missing this time.  In the past Amazon didn't include on, probably figuring by this time most people already had *something* capable of charging their latest device and would prefer to save a couple bucks.  This time they tossed one in.  Still, if you haven't sprung for a Bolse® 4 Port High Output Charger buy now, you're missing out.

Reviews.Title: Better than any tablet on the market!
Reviews.Author: Nigel
Reviews.Content: The best Kindle ever.  It does everything that has been advertised and more.  I love, love, love it - for someone who does not easily learn how to operate electronic items this was as easy as 1,2,3.  Thank you Amazon for a great product!!

Reviews.Title: Not an Android tablet - very limited
Reviews.Author: R. Precourt
Reviews.Content: I recommended the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 to my uncle who wanted a tablet just for basic stuff like e-mail, web browsing, Skype, etc.  I thought this one may be the best fit for him because he is not very tech savy and always asking me for help with his computer.  The 'Mayday' feature was the tipping point over other tablets as he could get assistance right on the device.I ordered the device for him and had it shipped to myself for setup and planned to ship it out to him, along with a wi-fi router already configured to it.  While performing the initial setup I quickly realized that this was not going to be a good fit at all, dispite the Mayday feature.  Here are my observations.The first problem I ran into was that the Kindle OS is VERY limited on settings compared to any other Android device that I've used (and I've used many over many years.)  The first thing I wanted to change was font size as he is older and would have difficulty reading the extremely small print size and found that there are only two settings for font size (normal and large, which isn't much larger than normal.)  On some screens it's acceptable, but on others it's still SO small, like the registration page for example.  It does have a 'magnifier' setting, but that is a pain to use as you have to pan around the screen to see everything with two figner swipes.  All my other Android devices have five (5) different font size choices, allowing easy reading of the entire screen at one time.  I found the limitation of settings options to be the case throughout the device menus - very few customization settings options.The second big problem which was the deal breaker is that you MUST provide credit card information, address, etc in order to download FREE apps.  I confirmed this with a rep over the Mayday feature, which I must say does work flawlessly.  My uncle did not want to provide this information as he never plans on downloading anything that would cost him, as he will only be using this for basic things.No flash support at all, at least out of the box.  I know this can be an issue on other tablets, like iPad especially, however, I could not get any videos to play on the Kindle Fire at all, not even YouTube, which generally will work on any other tablet I've owned.  Couldn't try downloading any other browsers or apps due to the need for a credit card to download free apps.At this point I gave up and decided to return it and get him the Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 instead, as it is a full featured Android tablet and won't require him to provide credit card information to download free apps from the Google play store.In all fairness, I realize this device might not be designed to be a full featured tablet, but I was hoping for more and did not expect it to be locked down so much.There are good things about it though, if you can deal with the other shortcomings.  The screen is amazing!  The sound quality is also very good.  It's lightweight and seems to run pretty fast (although I really couldn't do much with it to explore that.)  The Mayday feature is great also!  The camera takes good pictures, although it seems to take a long time to focus.If you are a Kindle user and want a device for that purpose this is a great product that goes beyond the basic Kindle experience.  If you're looking for a more robust Android tablet you may want to look at some of the other choices out there.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed...Read the return policy
Reviews.Author: Rosalie Buck "CHESSNUT"
Reviews.Content: The device I purchased in January would not connect to wireless or update my email unless I powered down 2 to 3 times a day. I spoke with Mayday , customer support and the tech team several times over a period of about 5 weeks. No one helped or was able to resolve the problem. Finally I was told that Amazon was aware of this particular problem with other devices and a software update would fix the problem. It was not fixed. I was told a replacement would likely have the same problem, so I decided to return the Kindle as well as the case (which will only fit the Kindle).I paid $523.99 for the Kindle and case. I have been refunded $371.20 due to a RESTOCKING fee of $92.80 ... I do hope they don't sell this particular device to someone else...There were other deductions as well as a denial for a refund for the case because I returned it after the 30 days allowed...my attempts to have the Amazon team resolve my problem took too long to benefit me in any way I guess.It's been disappointing.I'm going to the Apple Store............

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet if you're ok with having JUST Amazon right out of the box....
Reviews.Author: drEville
Reviews.Content: To preface, this was my very first tablet but I'm at the very least a tech enthusiast so I wanted to know full well what I was getting into when I had purchased this.I wanted a tablet for media consumption first and foremost but the option to do light office work if need be as well. Nothing too in depth just some basic office apps. I also would like to have a tablet that I could sync with my Android phone but that wasn't a deal breaker, I could live without that option.I was contemplating this tablet or the Nexus 7, Asus Memo FHD 10" tablet, or a Samsung one. Well the Nexus 7 screen was too small for me especially when watching Netflix or movies but was awesome for gaming. The Samsung tablets were surprisingly expensive when compared to other tablets that offered more in terms of screen display, speed, and functionality (I think my biggest dismay with Samsung is their Touchwhiz overlay. I mean it's good when it works but it sucks when it doesn't, I have a Galaxy S4.) I didn't like the size of the 10" tablets, so I thought an 8-9" tablet would be a good compromise and it turned out to be the perfect size range for me.Now I knew that the Kindles come with an Amazon skin, Mojito 3.0 OS as they like to call it, on all their hdx tablets and this works well....for the most part, depending on what type of person you are with a tablet. Now onto the positives and negatives.I'll touch first on the positives, IMHO.-The screen is fantastic. The colors "pop" out and really are vibrant. What's even better is the battery life paired with this is phenomenal, at least in my usage. (I'll touch on this a little later.) You can really tell that they had put some time and effort into making the screen one of the best. I think it really shows the ingenuity of how well they were able to push a wonderfully looking screen. The PPI is almost absurd, 339, with a resolution of 2560 x 1600. Incredible, especially when Apple's own Ipad Air has this; 2048 x 1536 resolution at 264 pixels per inch (ppi). Kudos to you Amazon for making such a wonderful and beautiful display. Oh, and having 100% sRGB color accuracy helps with making all the images and colors shine and pop out. All my movies and shows really looked astounding in low or high lighting. Touch reaction was spot on, no lag. Everything was very responsive and concise. Very impressive screen.-The speakers.....oh my the speakers. They too are awesome. When I had first turned on my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", my gf almost didn't believe the sound was coming from a tablet! The sound is fantastic, not the absolute best, but close to it. You can really hear the Dolby Digital from within these speakers. The highs and mids are great while the lows are discernable enough to make them sound as they should, given what speakers they're coming from. Even on the highest volume setting, the sound was still clear and crisp. It didn't sound muffled or reduced as you would hear in some speakers. TBH, I never tried the listening through the headphones so I can't comment on that, sorry.-The battery. Very impressive, imo. I had used my tablet for an avg. day, 4-6 hrs with mostly gaming and watching videos, some light reading (Had the Amazon Prime Free trial membership while had my Kindle Fire hdx.) The brightness was always set to auto. I didn't have any email setup so never had to push notify there. So specifically speaking, I used this tablet strictly for watching videos and playing games, while doing some light reading. I would charge my tablet about once every 3-4 days. The charge time was always brief, never going over a few hours, charged just as fast if not faster than my Galaxy s4. Battery was impressive with my usage.-Speed. Not much to comment here other than it was super fast! It's the only tablet I've seen so far that changes orientation from landscape to portrait INSTANTLY. I mean instantly, no lag whatsoever. It was nice. With a quad core Snapdragon 800 on 2.2 GHz Krait 400, it flies. Add to boot it has an Andreno 330 GPU and 2gb of ram, it has the latest and greatest processing power at this time. It definitely showed when playing games or multitasking. Apps loaded with ease, everything was super responsive, no lag whatsoever that I had encountered.-Cameras. I opted for the 32g version as I wasn't sure how much of personal content I was going to add on here. I never used the camera other than for a test. I like the fact that the HDX 8.9" version has a LED back flash and an overall better camera on it than the HDX 7" but it's really not needed but nice to have, for me it wasn't necessary. To note, the HDX 8.9" has both a front and rear facing camera with a LED flash on the back. I add this to my positives b.c even though it's not really necessary to have a camera on a tablet it's nice to have "just in case".-Size. The overall dimensions of this tablet are great. It's actually pretty light and not at all bulky or thick. The dimensions are what is expected in this day and age for top end tablets. Unless you tack on the Amazon made and endorsed Origami case onto it which adds almost double the weight. It surely protects but it adds a considerable amount of bulk.-Having Amazon Prime. If you're already a member or thinking of becoming one then an Amazon Kindle is the way to go if you want a tablet. It offers a bundle of advantages to Kindle Fire owners when they also have Prime, it's a great service. However, in recent days I've read and heard they are looking to increase the price of Amazon Prime because of shipping costs (2 day free shipping is included in Prime.) and the like but I guess that's still in the talks and perhaps their may not be a price hike after all? Hope not. :)  You get to borrow one book/mo from their extensive library, you have access to their Prime video library (I honestly think Netflix is better but to each their own.), and other nice features as well.Negatives-Tied exclusively to Amazon...Now before I say anything else, some people may view this as a positive but again, I said these were IMHO. I know you could root and flash to another ROM but outside the box you're stuck with just Amazon and their regulated ecosystem. (Some people don't want to take the risk of voiding their warranty or bricking their devices just to get it to run an Android rom or the like. I understand that it can be a simple process but sometimes the risk doesn't negate the end result for some.) I didn't think much of it initially but as the days went by I was becoming more envious of not having the Play store. I bought this tablet mainly for media consumption so I had hoped I would be set on what Amazon provided...I was. For a bit. I liked the idea that Amazon has "coins" you can purchase for a discounted price in which you can use anywhere in their mobile store. The Amazon store is good but if you're looking for game or other entertainment apps then the Play or App store is the way to go.-No external sd card port. I know that with the newer versions of Android most apps and games you can't transfer to the sd card but knowing it's there in case you want to save personal music, vids, or pics, is nice to know. I will say in the Kindle Fire HDX's defense it has a nice cloud based server to "drop" things into but at this moment I'm not completely sold on the "cloud" universe yet. Time will tell.-Read up on some current Fire HDX owners complaining about their power adapter plug-in port becoming loose or outright breaking. I don't want to scare anyone but please be forewarned that this is an issue, how big or small Idk but it was one of the top complaints when I did my research. I was leery myself b.c the way the charger adapter plugs in is very odd and can easily seeing it being broken or malfunctioning in the future and the incidents where people had notified Amazon about it, well that's another story. It plugs in at an angle slighted towards up. It's kind of odd that it would plug in at an angle and not level with the tablet. It looks very wonky, imo. With my luck, the charging port would break a day after the warranty, lol.OVERALLIf you shop Amazon frequently, or have Amazon Prime, plan on getting it, or want a tablet that's easy to use comparatively (Mayday button is a great feature for noobies and the like.) then this tablet is for you. If this tablet had the option to either have the Amazon store or the Play store downloaded right out of the box then I would've downloaded the Play Store and would have kept my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"  I honestly couldn't take having a "locked" down app store but again to each their own. I like having Google Voice, Maps, Gmail, etc right out the box. So instead of keeping my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", I had replaced it with the LG G pad 8.3" tablet and my the differences. It's almost night and day even though they are both running Android technically. I will be writing a review for that tablet once I get to know all the nuances with that one.But overall the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is an AWESOME tablet. It's just I, myself, didn't like having just the Amazon store and no direct access to the Play store especially when I had purchased some apps from there on my Galaxy s4. I would highly recommend this tablet it you're looking to use it to read, watch movies, and some other light entertainment activities.For gaming and productivity I would undoubtedly recommend an Android, Windows, or Apple tablet.Happy shopping and thanks for reading my take on the Amazon Kindle Fired HDX 8.("

Reviews.Title: Unbelieveable how much improved....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from my original 8.9" fire. WOW!! lightning fast, great viability in bright sunlight, Connection to the net great. Sound much improved, light as a feather. I could not be more satisfied. What an improvement! I recommend the Fire HDX to anyone looking for a super fast, well designed tablet. Especially if you are a  book reader, surf the net (which with the HDX is so much faster now it's hard to even compare to the original Fire 8.9"...... I bought the 32Gig, with WyFi. I didn't opt for 4G. I can only imagine how that could make it better. The Fire HDX 8.9" 32 GB gets 5 Stars... because there aren't 6 or more.Dr. Geoffrey Britt

Reviews.Title: Finally Amazon Matched or exceeded Ipad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Finally, Amazon learned as how to make an excellent tablet. It has all the features you want - light enough to hold on one hand, best resolution in tablets, all the apps that most people use (I am assuming that 80% of the folks use 20% of the apps), outstanding exchange email app that sync contacts with facebook, front/rear facing camera and last but not the least - very fast. Top it off with all the content and the best cover I have seen for a tablet - There is the perfect combination. I bought the wifi version and after 15 minutes, I wish I had ordered a 4G LTE version. It is so good that I want to be able to use it all the time wherever I am. Also it doesnt have a Youtube app, but the safari browser can play youtube in HiDef. So for me, it works!Folks, you wont be disappointed by getting one of this.

Reviews.Title: Very Cool
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Alright, I've been using a Galaxy Tab 8.9.  It's been a good tablet, a workhorse for me, but it's past it's prime.  I initially balked at the Fire when it was first introduced.  Not enough apps, the presentation was so different, etc.  But a few months ago, I ran thru all the apps I use every day and they were all offered by Amazon's App Store.  Combine that with the fact that I'm an Amazon super-user, I decided to take the plunge and get the Kindle HDX 8.9.Well, I've been using it non-stop for about 6 hours and it's awesome.  Display is fantastic, very light, Everything loads fast, video streams well, and my books look great. (No blue tint on border that I can see.  I've read in different settings and lighting, and no color tinge of any kind.)As an Amazon Prime and Audible member, I was also looking forward to their integration into the Fire.  It is great!  Amazon Video is fully integrated and I can even download some shows, apparently.  Haven't tried it, but looking forward to it.  Great option for traveling, I think.  And with Audible integrated into the Fire, you can do immersion reading if you own both the Kindle and Audio versions of a book.  That sounded cool to me when I heard it . . . and it is!  I recommend it to all readers out there.  A lot of great deals to be had as well i.e. Many Kindle books have a deal that once you purchase the ebook, you can purchase the Audible version for $.99-3.99 Great deals.The only thing I'm working thru is getting used to the interface.  It's pretty, and it makes sense, but it's new to me so there's a bit of learning curve.  But I'm getting there.Lots of other bells and whistles, but that's my initial impressions.  I wholly recommend it to anyone looking for a high performance tablet at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, but does lack a little.
Reviews.Author: Jackie Gill
Reviews.Content: First, I am giving this 5 stars because it really is beautiful, has an outstanding display, and is very light. However, it does have some limitations.What I like:The display! I have had an original iPad, a 4th generation iPad with Retina, and an iPad mini - this display blows them out of the water.The speed: This pad works flawlessly. There are no hangups, no freezes, and no stuttering during video playback.iCal CAN sync with this: Many will say that your iCal cannot sync with your Droid based devices. YES IT CAN. All of my computers are Macs and I love iCal. Furthermore, my Macs store all of my contacts and task lists. There are apps that will sync your contacts, calendar, and your tasks. I use CalDav-Sync available via Kindle store and Google play and everything I update on my Mac shows up on my Note 3 and Kindle HDX. I do not care for the included Kindle calendar (I am a big calendar person) so I also bought AwesomeCalendar and it is a great calendar app. CalDav also works to update this calendar with all of my information on my Mac and I never have to do a thing to make it happen.Reading Features: I considered the following before purchasing this Kindle: iPad mini with retina, Samsung Note 8.2", and a Kindle HDX 7. I am pretty tired of Apple products. I am not saying they aren't great, and it is the only computer I will buy, but I like new things. Each time I purchased a new i-product it seemed so much like the previous that it just didn't feel new. Therefore, even though the new Mini with retina is beautiful, I ruled it out. I really like the size, shape, and feel of the new Samsung Note 8.2." Samsung went back to black and moved away from that strange brown decision and I love the ability to use the stylus. Plus, I also switched from an iPhone to a Note 3, so this means all of the Apps I have purchased in Google Play would be available for my pay as well. So, this being said, the Samsung Note 8.2" was almost my new pad. However, it is very similar to my Note 3 and the the Kindle beats everyone in one area: READING. Yes, you can get the Kindle app on your other products, but you can't get immersion reading. I have not built my library via iBooks, luckily I have purchased all of my books via Kindle. So, when I opened my box and pulled out my new Kindle, they were all there. I am a PhD student in the dissertation phase, so I read A LOT. not all of my books have been available via Kindle, but when they are they are less expensive and I love the note taking features. I do think the note taking features and highlighting works better on the Kindle than it does through the Kindle app. You are allowed multiple highlighting colors to choose from, it keeps track of my notes and reading on all of my devices, and you can get the audio versions of the books (if available) for very good prices. I have been an Audible fan for a long time. I know many do not care for audio versions, they prefer to read. Immersion reading combines them! This is WONDERFUL for me because I like to accomplish tasks while listening to a book, but if I need to highlight something, the immersion reading will show me where I am and I don't have to hunt. This is a big upgrade and what tipped my decision to make this purchase. Now, at the time I was not thinking about actually carrying this thing around while I listened, and the 8.9 is a little large for that, perhaps the 7 would have been the better choice, but the 8.9 isn't too heavy and I can always listen on my sisters 7", or i-product if I am moving around and it will sync with my 8.9" to let me know exactly where I left off.The organization of the Home screen: I really like the carousel and the folders that you place apps in. Unlike Apple app folders, the Kindle allows you to place many apps in a folder (this may have changed in recent Apple IOS updates, not sure).Weight: Very light! I like the feel of this pad. It is lighter than the iPad air and does not feel cheap to me (the 7 inch does not feel substantial enough to me).Aesthetics: I love the all over black! I find this to be a beautiful pad. Comparing it to the iPads, I cannot say that one is better looking than the other because I think they are both beautiful in their different ways; however, this has a rubberized back that makes it MUCH easier to hold onto. I also prefer the shape. iPad is a little wider and I don't think it is necessary. I prefer the more 16:9 shape. I had a very difficult time deciding on whether to buy this because of size. I found that an 8" display was perfect. The full size iPad was too large and too heavy. The iPad mini was just right, although I still prefer the more rectangular look of the Kindle 8.9" and Samsung 8". I felt the 7" Kindle was just too small. The 7" feel a little cheap to me and there just isn't enough screen for reading. Moving back up from the 8" mini made me nervous. I will say that I do wish this Kindle was slightly smaller. Even moving down to an 8.3 - 8.5 would probably help, but it is not overwhelming. I am still happy that I chose the 8.9" over the 7" and I really do like the size and shape when viewing movies.Ability to download free content: One of the big pluses of a Kindle is Prime. I know you can download content from iTunes and get movies and such that way, but I have NO DESIRE to pay $20 for a download I will watch once. We take a road trip every summer and WiFi/4G is not always available. Plus, streaming via 4G eats up a lot of data. So, I wanted to be able to download movies and TV to watch on the road. You can do this with Prime and they do have free content (I'll also discuss this more under what I don't like). Amazon also gives away a free paid App a day. This is pretty cool. I log in every day and download most of them. Most are games, I would like more variety, but they are free :-).Origami Case: if you buy the Kindle HDX 8.9 or 7, I highly recommend the origami case. For my previous i-products I have purchased multiple cases and contraptions to hold them where and how I wanted them. Never has any case been as nice and met all of my needs like this one. I did and do not like the price of this case. It is about even with Apple brand leather iPad cases, but those are incredibly overpriced as well (and I do not like Apple smart covers, they are far inferior to this case). However, this case, at least, does a GREAT job. I did choose the leather and I am glad I did. It feels like a very nice quality leather, has not scuffed, smells good, and the Kindle fits it perfectly. The case also allows you to easily push the Kindle up to take photos, control power, and control volume. My sister bought one of the non-leather origami cases for her Kindle HDX 7, and while the case functions just the same and is a great color, I really prefer the leather - it just feels better, looks nice, and has a leather rather than chemical smell. The magnets in this case are great, holds very securely, and they turn the unit on and off. The case folds back flat, or holds the unit vertically or horizontally; and, if you like to read it bed, it does a great job of holding the Kindle up on your stomach or on a pillow. Again, while I agree this case is expensive, I do believe it is the only case I will need to buy for my Kindle.What I don't Like:Number one biggest complaint - DESKTOP BACKGROUND and Home screen images. You cannot change them! This is crazy to me. I did not expect this and I am disappointed. This in no way has anything to do with the function of the device, but I really like personalizing. I chose no advertising - there is enough of that in the world - and I removed the Amazon recommends section on the home-screen; but, that is where my choices ended. I cannot change the black background and I cannot choose what images greet me when I open my cover. I don't know if Amazon chose to do this because of their advertisers and/or for ease of help via MayDay (which I have never used, it isn't a complicated tablet), but I DO NOT LIKE IT. I want to open my pad and be greeted by my Boston Terrier, not a generic picture (although the lock screen images are pretty nice looking). I think this could be easily fixed via software update, but I also assume Amazon left this common feature out on purpose and doesn't plan to include it.Amazon Prime Free Content: I stream via Prime and Netflix and between the two I get most of what I want. However, I wanted to be able to download shows and movies and take them on the road with me. First, know that this EATS YOUR MEMORY. I chose the 64GB pad and it doesn't take much to fill it if you choose HD - a couple of movies and a few episodes of a show and you are full. You can choose lower quality, but it does look inferior on this exceptional screen. Downloading HD is also incredibly slow. I have pretty fast connection, but HD takes forever! That being said, the worst part is that there really isn't much to download. Sure, Prime offers a lot, however the majority of Prime cannot be downloaded. Hopefully this will change, but this is a feature that I was hoping to get a lot more out of.Size: The jump from a 7" to an 8.9" is pretty big. I wish they would offer an 8.2 - 8.5." It would be a little more slender, easier to fit in a large pocket and easier to hold with one hand. One thing I like about the 7" is that I can hold and control it with one hand. The 8.9" requires two hands. Still the size it much better than the full size iPad.App Store: I don't feel the app store is all that lacking. It is pretty extensive and serves most of my purposes. Unfortunately I have had to purchase duplicate apps because my iTunes purchases obviously don't transfer and Kindle does not use the Google Play store. The perfect device would allow purchases from all of them, but I get that this won't work. There are apps in all three app stores that are not available for one or the other. So, there are still apps on my i-products that I can't find for my Android devices and there are apps via Droid that I can't find for my i-products.Final thoughts: The perfect pad for me would be around 8.3 inches, include a Samsung-like stylus, have the power and performance of i-products, work with an app store that has all apps for all platforms, be very customizable, be very light, and include all of the reading features and Prime features of Kindle. It would also fit in an Origami case because it really is the best case I have used. That being said, at this point, Kindle simply offers more of what I am looking for in a tablet. I don't know if my perfect pad will ever exist, but, in the mean time, this one is pretty great!

Reviews.Title: HDX 8.9 is Fantastic and and the Installment Plan is Great!
Reviews.Author: TLS
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle from the 2nd generation through PaperWhite.  I have looked at the Fire for quite a while but was not sure how the reading experience would be.  Then I saw I could pay for a Fire on a no-interest installment plan - so I went for it.  The marketing beauty of the installment plan is that it lets you upgrade to the larger size Fire over five payments rather than one big lump.  Memo to Jeff Bezos: smart, very smart in coming out with the installment plan.Now about the Fire experience.  It is great on all fronts - I've watched a movie, read The Week magazine, and read a book.  Looked at YouTube videos using the free app.  Downloaded other apps.  The screen is so sharp, the 8.9 size is great and it's not too heavy, the battery life is pretty close to stated, and the interface is very easy to understand.  Since I have the PaperWhite, a lot of the learning curve was already taken care of.  However, even if you have never used a Kindle product, the interface is very intuitive.Of course, the breadth and depth of the Amazon ecosystem means just about any book, digital magazine, movie, or whatever is available with one click (maybe that's why Amazon calls it "one click").  And Prime means you can see a lot of movies and TV shows at no cost (think Downtown Abbey, Hunger Games and 007 Skyfall).  Getting Prime if all you are looking for is video content may not be the best deal at $99 (I paid $79 in the last few days before the rate went up).  However, if you do a lot of Amazon purchases, the 2nd day shipping is awesome and on top of that you get video content!The Fire 8.9 out of box experience was great.  No defects, no blue margin haze, started up and has run like a champ from the very first moment.So here is the bottom line from my perspective.  If all you are doing is reading long form text in books, the PaperWhite is the best solution.  However, if you have ever had the desire to watch a movie, read a digital magazine, check out what's happening on YouTube, etc. - buy, buy, buy the Kindle Fire.  The reading experience is very, very good and a whole new world opens up through the diverse capabilities of the Fire.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Cathleen Countryman
Reviews.Content: The color is fantastic and even better it's so easy to use which is key for me. I don't have little ones to show me how to use technology and I find this one to be seamlessly easy to use. Plus help is available from Amazon. Super usable and super high quality. I'm so happy to have this.  My sister has the I-PAD and I like mine soooo much better!  Thanks Amazon for a great product.

Reviews.Title: So much better than my iPad
Reviews.Author: Michelle B. "Originally from Kansas"
Reviews.Content: I've had all 4 of the iPad generations prior to the iPad Air.  I was trying to decide between getting the new iPad Air or a Kindle Fire HDX 8.9".  My requirements were for something to take on long haul flights loaded with movies and books.  I chose the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" because of its size (lightweight), its resolution and access to my Amazon Prime assets. In my travels with my current iPad, I would have to clear the iPad and reset to load even two movies and 3 books.  Very frustrating.  I've had to go back to factory settings three times.  Granted I have less memory on this iPad, but.....I was a bit worried after I first got it because I had read I couldn't download any of the Amazon Prime free movies....not true....and, because I read that once I rent other movies on amazon, I could only download 2 movies...again, not true. I now have 5 movies and a ton of books downloaded....I'm ready for my next long haul.  I'll update this review after my trip.

Reviews.Title: Would have been 5 stars except for...
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Baldwin
Reviews.Content: If I had done this a month ago I would have rated it 5 stars.  It still is, in and of itself; but here is the thing.  I have all Kindles!  All of them.  The first, just a reader is the best thing I have ever bought, it is perfect in every way.  It is old now and I still use it and still does what it is supposed to do.  Then I got the Kindle Fire.  It was ok but had No Volume, I sent it back and Amazon send another one and it was fine.  Not impressive but still ok.  Then came the Kindle HD.  It was great but had one dead pixel, so it went back, the replace is fine.  When it came time for the HDX I was ready!  Couldn't wait, bought it the first day available.  For better than a month it was absolutely perfect!  No problem of any kind in any way.  Then all of a sudden it had full RAM.  Could get out of its own way.  To make it worse, when I called Mayday, they had no idea what I was talking about.  They just said well you have 64 GB and only 11 GB is used so it is ok.  I explained that we were talking about RAM and that it only had 2 GB so they said well in that case it is bad!  So again they replaced it.  This one so far is perfect.  But of the four I've bought three went back!  That is too bad.  I have suggested to a lot of folks that they buy this Kindle and I do believe it is the best choice out there, but I am embarrassed that of those my friends have bought some of them have already gone back.  It is called Quality Control.  Amazon Figure it out!

Reviews.Title: The Best at What It Does
Reviews.Author: TEQ "TEQ1"
Reviews.Content: Sound was the deciding factor when deciding to purchase either an Apple Air or an Android tablet such as the Kindle Fire HDX.  Apple puts not effort into the audio experience of their tablets and laptops, assuming, I guess, that everyone will want to use those damned earbuds all the time.  I got really tired of plugging in an external Logitec stereo device into my iPad 3 whenever I wanted to watch a movie, really tired.  Make no mistake, the HDX's speakers don't generate a concert-like experience, but it's far better than the iPad Air.  I also found the reduction in size and better display resolution to be helpful for reading.  Easier to hold, and fonts are rendered far more smoothly on the HDX display than Apple's retinal screen.  Steve Jobs would have to agree.  I don't understand why buyers would rather put up with continuous advertising than paying the few extra bucks for the ad-free version of the Fire HDX.  The HDX's version of Android also is kind of annoying.  Transferring movies from computer to tablet requires third-party software to remove DRM coding, whereas with Apple and even the plain Kindle Fire, movies are a simple drag and drop task.  Android's a pretty decent OS, but you wouldn't know it by the HDX.  You also have to be careful with Amazon Prime video.  Amazon subtly combines rental/purchase movies & TV with it's free Prime content, and it's pretty easy to press 'Watch Instantly' and later find out you've paid $5.00 to rent a movie.  You also probably notice a yellow cast to the display, especially with skin tones.  This is likely intentional to make the display appear better than it is, but I don't know why the Kindle makers thought this necessary since it's already the best display out there.  OK, so most Kindle buyers will likely just read, watch video and surf the web.  The HDX is very light & handy for doing these things.  Look at the limited accessories & general apps available and you'll understand it's not good to overreach with this devise. You will look silly bringing a Kindle to that important conference. My only other suggestion is to go with a vinyl skin rather than a TPU cover or folding case to protect your Kindle HDX.  I tried a TPU cover and it just bugged me. The Kindle Fire HDX  is really thin and light.  Keep it that way.

Reviews.Title: I compared and this table won out
Reviews.Author: Stu Redman
Reviews.Content: If you go out on the internet and read tablet comparisons, you will find multiple "professional writers" running down the Amazon tablets.  They will tell you that you are limited to Amazons selection of apps, which is insufficient.  That the Kindles are only good if you are an Amazon Prime subscriber.  Well, that is simply not true of these newest tablets.  While the Amazon app store is not complete, it does have a ton of the most popular apps.  If you can't find what you need there, you can do an internet search and find out how to load any Android app on your Kindle.  And it is not rocket science.  The interlinking of Amazons content to the Kindle can not be shortchanged.  It is wonderful how my wife and I have all of our music, pictures, documents and videos stored in Amazons cloud and can access them easily, very easily, wherever we are.  The ability to watch many Amazon prime videos is amazing.  We are sold on this tablet.I use Amazon for most of my purchases and update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product. You can look at my review which will be close to my purchase date and tell how the product is doing as time passes.  I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.UPDATE:  It has been about two months since we received our tablet.  We added it to our mobile share plan with AT&T; so that my wife would have access to email and the internet anywhere she wants it.  She can also use a mapping program and since this unit has GPS, she can use it instead of her separate GPS unit when traveling.  She is in the process of converting to using the tablet instead of the daily planner she has been using for years to keep track of appointments and important dates as well as keep notes in.  She uses the tablet for gaming or reading in her downtime wherever she is and occasionally watches Amazon Prime video too.  She is very happy with this unit and can not think of any down sides to it.

Reviews.Title: Great First Impression
Reviews.Author: Moonlight Graham "Ben"
Reviews.Content: Upon first inspection, I was thoroughly impressed with the look and design of the Kindle Fire HDX. Having owned both the original Kindle Fire and a Kindle Fire HD, I was unsure about the need to upgrade. I couldn't help myself, though. The ability to download Prime movies was exactly what I was waiting for, since I take the train downtown every day. I'm actually impressed with the availability of downloads. I've already downloaded a bunch of episodes of The Shield, Friday Night Lights, and Sherlock. The quantity of available Prime videos for download may seem like it's not enough, but I can only assume Amazon will be vastly expanding this as time goes on.The picture quality was the first thing I noticed. This thing is razor sharp. The video plays very, very well on it, and the sound is good as well. I typically only use my headphones. My only gripe is that changing the volume is a two-step process on the screen now. I'm not sure why they made that harder - you have to tape the screen, then tap the volume icon, then adjust the volume. Previously, the volume slider was available with a simple tap on the screen. I hope they change that with an upgrade. The volume +/- is also on the back of the HDX, which makes it harder to adjust while using a case.This thing is almost weightless. The oragami case more than doubles the weight of it. It is truly impressive how light they have made this while keeping the price down.There is, however, one bad thing, that I'm hoping is just a glitch. My HDX froze after connecting to a new wireless network. It was unable to turn back on. I contacted Amazon's technical support, which was awesome. They're shippng me a replacement, which will be here in two days. The customer service was outstanding, and while this was an unfortunate issue, I wouldn't dock the HDX a star for it (yet). If it happens more often or to other people, it would definitely be a detriment to the reputation of the product. I'm guessing it was an isolated incident, though. I've never had a problem with my other Amazon devices, so I have confidence the replacement HDX will do just fine. I will update the review if anything happens with that one.Overall, this thing is amazing. I do think it's worth the upgrade, especially if you have an original Kindle Fire. The video quality is great, and the ability to download Prime videos is amazing and makes the device worth it on its own if you commute on a train. I'm looking forward to using this thing every day for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Tablet
Reviews.Author: SAB
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would be a tablet person. I got my Kindle Fire and it has become my go to entertainment device. I love reading books on it and love the fact that Kindle book prices are lower than print! I am amazed at the quality of the picture with movies and TV shows. I use it daily and find it easy to use and add apps and books. I am a convert!

Reviews.Title: I like it when indoors
Reviews.Author: Kathryn L. Newton "klofcolo"
Reviews.Content: I really like it indoors, but I hate it outdoors.  I like to go outside with my dog and sit on the patio and it is almost impossible to see anything on the screen outside.  I like to photograph Birds and Wildlife and outside I can't see what I have - I have just a Kindle Touch reader so I use that outside and the Kindle Fire inside.  I would not order another one!

Reviews.Title: absolutely love it!!
Reviews.Author: Tia
Reviews.Content: I received my new kindle this week, and test-drove it on a 6 hour flight. At this time, I have only positive things to say about it, and I will highlight some points for those who are thinking about making the purchase- I know they are expensive.I purchased the 64 gb version because I have an external hard drive of movies that I will rotate on my kindle. At the beginning, I put 8 2-hour movies on it, and still had space. So if you don't plan to add external media, you will be fine with  smaller data size.The internet works fast. All of my amazon media content is stored in my cloud. Any games that you purchased for a previous kindle will not transfer, so be advised of that. The picture quality is awesome, the graphics jump out at you, I couldn't be more pleased.The battery lasts forever. I used the kindle constantly throughout my flight, switching between movies and games, and still had plenty of juice. The machine is very easy to operate, and was cheaper than the iPad.I also like the book display. This kindle has a built-in backlight and magazines display nicely- as do comic books. I highly recommend this kindle.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware of Many Issues
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I own one of the older Kindle Fires and was excited to receive this as a gift from my husband.  It worked OK in the beginning but within a few months it began shutting itself down. It would not come back on unless you did the hard reset, which is holding the power button down for 30 seconds.  This issue continued along with the fact that it would drop your internet connection and it would not update your email unless you shut it completely off.  After a few months of this my husband convinced me to contact Amazon.  The tech I talked to told me that the covers that Amazon sold could be part of the problem and I removed it.  He also tried to get me to reset to factory defaults and I asked to wait and let me give the coverless Kindle a try.It was better but still not right.  Finally I had enough when it shut down on me over 12 times in a row.  Each time staying on less than 45 seconds and freezing.  I did a reset to factory defaults in one of my 45 second windows.  When I tried to set it up again, it froze up.  Needless to say, I once again contacted Amazon and once again, I had to speak with someone that I could not understand.  He tried to get me to reset again and would not listen when I told him it wouldn't stay on long enough for me to do anything.  I got frustrated and hung up on him.My next step was live chat.  I chatted with someone and explained my problem  He must have clocked out for the day because suddenly I was chatting with someone else and he wanted to know what the problem was again.  He was not helpful and if anything I found him to be defensive.  My only option he said was to return it and he had no idea about the covers being a problem.I asked if I was going to get another new one or a refurbished one and he couldn't tell me.  Although he did agree to replace my cover.  He is sending the cover with one day shipping and my Kindle with two day shipping.  What sense does that make?The only positive thing I can about it is the screen is nice when it does decide to work. If I had it to do over I would have asked for the iPad instead.  Live and Learn.  Don't waste your money.UPDATE 05/20/15:I wanted to let everyone know that I received my refurbished Kindle Fire HDX yesterday.  It was supposed to be here on Friday but even though I verified the correct address with the customer service rep twice, it was sent to another address that is not the main address on my account. I was able to contact another customer service rep and all they could say was that he made a mistake and then they had the Kindle re-routed to my home.  I am not happy that I received a used Kindle and the first customer service rep I spoke with told me he would make a note in my file that since mine wasn't used that often he would request a new one for me.  As I stated before the last rep I spoke with wasn't very nice and he couldn't tell me what they would send. I will update if this one gives me any problems.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!! Almost perfect!
Reviews.Author: James Duckett
Reviews.Content: I'm a big movie buff, so I wanted 64GB so I'd never have to worry about not having enough video to keep me entertained when I'm away from WiFi for a long time. Also, it's hard to tell what I'll be in the mood for, so I'll often load it up with movies that I might want to catch later. Some have sit there for months, and I still haven't been in the mood for them, but some day I will be and having 64GB certainly helps with that. I don't have to live in fear that I'll get in the mood for a show I don't have.The screen is beautiful. This is my go-to 10" tablet, mostly used for watching media and for playing a few games. I have a Kindle Paperwhite and I do all of my reading from that, so I don't use this for reading except in some rare situations. I love how this ties into my Audible account, so I always have my Audible books with me as well (again, thank you 64GB).Videos work awesome on this. The resolution is nice and crisp. The speakers are also awesome, though I do wish some tablet maker would have them facing the listener instead of going out the back. I feel like I'm missing a lot of sound with it shooting out its rear end. Sometimes I'll cup the speakers in a way that the sound is redirected back to me, but if I'm listening tot his device, I always do it from the back. Those speakers are awesome, Amazon, please, please, PLEASE figure out a way to move them up front.It says you should get 12 hours of battery life watching video. I've never experienced this. When it was new, maybe 7 hours of battery life. After a few months of using and charging, I can probably burn through a battery in 5 hours watching Hulu or streaming other media. I've seen worse (like Microsoft's Surface tablet and my Dell XPS tablet/laptop), but I expected better from Amazon, especially when it claims 12 hours while watching video and 18 hours while just reading. I'm not seeing it. Apple does tend to live up to their claims on battery life, in my opinion.Otherwise, I've got no regrets dropping $500 on this. I'm usually by a charging source, and since this uses standard USB and not some proprietary connector (*cough* *cough* APPLE *cough*), finding a charging source is easy. It doesn't seem to take long to fully charge this either... maybe an hour or so with a 2.1amp charger. $500 would get you the entry-level Apple iPad, which is only 16GB, which I can fill easily. I have a large-capacity iPad Mini, which is decent for watching shows on, but it seems to struggle with some video and games now and then. I find myself using my iPad Mini less and less and my HDX more and more.If I had to choose again, I'd pick up this HDX over the iPad in a heartbeat. When compared to some Android tablets, I'd have to do a lot more debating, but in that debate Apple would always take third place and, even then, would have to content with the Microsoft Surface.

Reviews.Title: piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Peter S Park
Reviews.Content: I just spoke with kindle support and they just notified me that my WiFi dropping issue is a known issue and that they are working on a fix.  This is extremely disappointing that amazon would release a product with this bad of a bug and no solutions to work around the problems.  Amazon will have to work hard to regain this customer's trust.Sincerely a long time prime member

Reviews.Title: My new baby!
Reviews.Author: Jenxie
Reviews.Content: I bought this over a week ago and am loving it. Very user friendly and the screen resolution is great. I bought this because I am about to start chemotherapy and radiation in a few weeks and I wanted something to search the internet and stream movies and tv during my treatments. (I don't do ebooks, real books for life!) The only thing that it's lacking is good apps but that's not surprising as I have an Android phone and already knew this. With that said, I'm still very happy I sprung for the 8.9 instead of the 7.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Clark Fleming
Reviews.Content: I had been putting off getting a Fire because I already have an iPad and also have a Kindle Paperwhite (very pleased with the paperwhite - especially for reading in a dark room).  Finally, after a friend's positive experience with a Kindle Fire, I decided to get one.  I truly enjoy this little tablet.  I use it to read, check email, and occasionally go to a web page for something.  Bar none, it's the easiest tablet on which to set up email accounts - all kinds:  POP, iMAP, gmail, Exchange Network.  Usually to get all my email accounts working I have to enter manually several items.  Not so with the Fire; it found it all automatically.  Silk (browser) is fast enough, but not as speedy as Safari.  I find myself carrying the Fire more and more.  The screen is out of sight, very high resolution and it shines through when watching any video.  If it is also reliable (I'll see), then Amazon has a real winner.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment!!!
Reviews.Author: PBoyles "PBoyles"
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love my original Kindle and used it all the time.  The new Kindle Fire awful; it shuts down all the time or it freezes up.  Not just occasionally but every few minutes and all the time no matter what I'm doing.  Even just reading a book the think restarts every couple of pages and does save my location.  Does everyone have this same experience or is mine the only one???

Reviews.Title: This 8.9 inch Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Albert Cantin
Reviews.Content: This is just so great to have! It can do so much and all the free apps really help also, so I would surely say this item was worth every having and even the on-line help comes in very handy! Anyone considering this, I would say; Do it!!

Reviews.Title: Happy with my new Kindle HDX 8.9!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Lavender
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle HDX 8.9, Wi-Fi, 64 GB!  I have the first generation 7" model which was very nice, but this larger size is really great.  My eyesight is not too good, so the larger size allows me to increase the font size and still be able to see a generous portion of the "page".  I loaded several PDF  documents I needed for a continuing education class to the HDX and took it to class.  I used the HDX all day long (without WIFI on) and still had 56% charge left.  I also downloaded a few free game apps which worked well.  VERY happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Fanatic
Reviews.Author: Deborah Camp "Author of more than 50 novels. ...
Reviews.Content: I am a Kindle Fire fanatic! Love, love, love it. I have the smaller version, as well. This tablet size is great for watching movies, surfing the Web, etc. I use it every day for hours and hours. Charges quickly. I took it out of the box and started using it right the next minute. Couldn't be easier. I plan to give them as gifts this Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Review 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Simply Love it!  I have the original Kindle Fire in 7" form and I am very pleased with it.  My wife gifted me the 8.9" Kindle Fire HDX and I am amazed at the improvements.  The tablet is an amazing device, very responsive, beautiful screen, does everything that I would use a tablet for.  It is light weight, ease to use in any orientation, all of my books and applications transferred over without an issue.  I have friends that use the Apple device, but the Kindle experience is much richer in my personal opinion.  Keep up the good work Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Glad I got it
Reviews.Author: Craig in IL "EasyDailyLiving"
Reviews.Content: Great for books, music, videos, email, games - just carrying around with you.  Wish I had started on this a year ago.  New version is lighter to carry than the year old version my wife uses.  Many other improvements, too.  I'm using this much more than I thought I would.

Reviews.Title: Just what you'd exspect it to be
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Its  very nice. I've used it daily since I received it and the battery life has been very good. It's easy to use and does everything  I hoped it'd do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle 64gb w/o special offers (Fun Tablet)
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: For starters, my kindle is 64gig, w/o special offers. Since this is my first tablet, I don't have much experience to compare to. I will say this, it is an impressive machine, since I have gotten my tablet I have used my computer less and I enjoy reading more. I meant to give it a 4.5 stars, unfortunately I can't. My reason is because it is a great tablet, but the graphics isn't that great when watching youtube videos. Of course, I go directly to the website instead of the app so that could be why. Overall, I am very happy with my kindle and hope that you like it as well!

Reviews.Title: Extreme improvement over last generation
Reviews.Author: Archaegeo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic device. Got Mirracast working with LG 55L.A.6900.  So far it is easily replacing my 3rd generation iPad. Little to say that other reviews.haven't covered.

Reviews.Title: More than just a Reader: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Donald C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I have owned other readers, but this is so much more than just a reader.  The book-reading function includes a full-blown dictionary and lots of other functions I haven't discovered.  But when you want more than a reader, you have a web browser, a very high resolution camera facing away from the user and a 1.9 megapixel facing the user, a calendar/appointment book that interfaces with the contacts list, and hundreds if not thousands of downloadable apps.  I am extremely happy with my new Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Title: Panasonic app does not work with the kindle
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle so I could load pictures from my lumix zs30 to the kindle using wifi.  When I tried the app it said it is outdated.  Now the people at kindle support want me to load pictures to my computer from the camera then load them from the computer to the kindle.  When I travel I will have to take a computer in addition to the camera and kindle.  No one at kindle support or amazon has said that they will add a usable app to solve this problem.  Seems to me this would be the correct response to solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: leo249
Reviews.Content: The good - very light, battery lasts a long time, you can play games, read magazines, watch movies, check your email, browse the internet and there are tons of applications for it.  The screen is very responsive to touch.  It has a beautiful screen; the colors are very vibrant.  I had no issues whatsoever connecting to my wireless network.  My wife uses it a lot for facebook.  She can just sit on the couch and doesn't have to sit in front of a computer anymore!  She takes it in the kitchen when cooking to follow the recipes she has pulled up on the screen.The bad - it has horrible glare.  If you want to use this product outside is just not going to work.Overall I thing this is a great tablet.  This is the first tablet we own so I have nothing to compare it to but I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Who needs a NOOK
Reviews.Author: mark earls
Reviews.Content: I received a discount offer prior to the holidays on electronics. Had not shopped Amazon in a while so decided to take a look - been seeing the commercials for the Fire HDX - we already had a Nook color - after reading the specs and reviews decided to purchase one. Could not be happier - the wife does not even use her Nook anymore she loved the Fire so much that I have ordered a 2nd one for her - great product - fast delivery - great customer care - could not be happier - heartily recommend if you are looking for a tablet/reader/net device

Reviews.Title: Very nice Kindle
Reviews.Author: Connie R. Johnston "RaznDazln"
Reviews.Content: Being a bit of a tech geek, I can't help but get the latest version of the Kindle.  I've had several including the 8.9" HD.  I'm still getting used to the new 8.9 HDX and, overall, find it to have more great features for how I use Kindle.  The sound is so much better, the camera for pictures and videos on the backside is really handy and the response time is much better.  The screen quality is outstanding!  I'm using the Dolphin browser and it works smoothly with the Kindle.  I use my Kindle a lot rather than using a computer. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but....
Reviews.Author: Mel "health nut"
Reviews.Content: ...like some other reviews, 2 weeks after receiving it, it crashed. I am covered for receiving a new device, but wondering about the longevity/quality...

Reviews.Title: Love it - with additions
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas.  As a reader and multimedia tablet I don't think I could have done better.Added a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse, and it serves quite well as a notepad as well.  With the keyboard and mouse it works really well to remote to my regular computer.  The one issue I have is that the google play store is not available (hint).  I have a couple of paid apps that are not available in the amazon store, and I don't want to pay twice for them.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: 5 out of 5! I got the HDX 8.9 because I wanted a little larger screen. I Love it! This is my new "baby." I am a college student and this makes a handy carry around. I don't need my lap top for all my classes and the Kindle is great for accessing info from the internet at a moments notice. I can't afford a smartphone on my tight budget but this Kindle lets me check my e-mail when I need to between classes. I have only begun to touch the surface of what this Kindle can do and I am entranced with it.

Reviews.Title: Just plain awesome!
Reviews.Author: buzznut
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these devices, 32GB, wi-fi only. My wife has her first device ever and she is loving it. We are not gamers or movie watchers and Amazon's app store has been sufficient for what we want. As a 30 year software engineer I am NOT looking for one more thing that needs constant attention to keep running. So far after one month I've not had to do any of this for either Kindle. We use them for Internet access, reading, weather and they more than meet our needs. It is really nice to be able to wander around the house without the weight and awkwardness of the laptop. We find we are charging the batteries about once a week so battery life has not been an issue either. The performance has been stellar and the screen display is amazing. I am looking forward to many, many hours of use and fun.

Reviews.Title: I Just Got It
Reviews.Author: J. T. Baker
Reviews.Content: I just got it the other day and am still playing around with it.  I did read the reviews before I bought it and it helped me decide on this purchase.  I'm definitely not a techie person so the reviews helped me ... not in the technical sense but that it seemed like a good buy for what I wanted.I bought the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 without offers so you can imagine my surprise when I got an offer while playing one of my games.  I connected with MayDay to ask "How come?"  Man, that is a very cool item.  A real person comes on ... a person I can actually understand (no outsourcing).  After explaining my question, she said it was an offer that is built in the game I was playing.  it wasn't a Kindle offer.  Okay, that explained that.  Bummer, though, that I will still get offers I don't want to be bothered with.  I love the MayDay option.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Bailey
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is a beautiful package.  I have only had it for 10 days so I have only touched on the capabilities, but everything I have done so far has been great.I'm very pleased with this new unit and very glad that I purchased it.  I bought one as a gift and that person loves it as well.I would most certainly recommend it to anyone considering it.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: J.C.A
Reviews.Content: I traded in my last Kindle HD with smaller screen because of battery drainage issues (I think these were unique to my unit since no one else complains of problems) and the desire to update to a forward and rear facing camera/video etc.I had no idea what I was about to receive would be a such a POWERHOUSE.  Apps load and run lightning fast, the power button and volume controls were moved to the rear and greatly enlarged, the speakers were moved to the top and seem to greatly improve the sound. Overall I am very pleased, I went back and forth between the 16 GB vs. 32 GB and I chose the smaller unit.  Maybe the 32GB would be a better choice for someone on the go with a number of movies/music.

Reviews.Title: 5TH KINDLE
Reviews.Author: wicky
Reviews.Content: This makes my 5th kindle and each one has been better. The Fire HDX 8.9 is no exception. It is easy to use, responsive and the thinner but larger size is comfortable to handle. I find the clarity of the screen excellent and the books easy to read. once again a quality kindle product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Helene Lovell
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire.  Although my first one died on me, decided to purchase the lastest model of Kindle Fire.  This one is wonderful!  Picture quality is excellent.  Like the way my Prime transferred to my new Kindle, along with all of my books.  This new model has lots more to offer.  Would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 its fantastic
Reviews.Author: LIN
Reviews.Content: I think the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is great.the color is.fantastic  and I love the screen  much.more convenient to read my books it so much lighter than my other one it's much.faster I just love it. The wider screen I am crazy about.

Reviews.Title: great on fire tablet
Reviews.Author: LSA "photo hacker"
Reviews.Content: faster outstanding screen clarity. Owned an original kindle fire and there is substantial improvement. Faster on internet than my desktop and laptop The ads on the start screen do not bother me. Amazon should have a hit with the product

Reviews.Title: Amazing new Kindle - best ever
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Combat journalist, media con...
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this tablet for my wife's birthday, replacing the Kindle HD 7 I bought her last year.  Wow!  This is the first electronic device I've ever bought on the first day.  In fact, I had the clerk at Best Buy go back to shipping and bring me one (they hadn't set up their display.  This is our fifth Kindle, starting with the 3rd generation, and this update blew me away.  These  guys are setting the standard for Retina-beating screens and an amazing sound system.  And it's shockingly light (of course my own tablet is a honking Nexus 10).We've been Prime members since it was first offered, and we're deeply into the Amazon eco-system.  The company's producing a quality product like this just lures me deeper, lol.

Reviews.Title: more than i expected
Reviews.Author: aparcelrn
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Well worth the money. Glad I went with this rather than the iPad. Haven't had any major bugs and its been a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Impressive piece of equipment!
Reviews.Author: Michael G Bacon
Reviews.Content: Love my Fire HDX 8.9"! Fast, very responsive, beautiful picture quality. Only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of the scarcity of compatible apps. If that issue is corrected it'll be a definite 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Darcell
Reviews.Content: Plan on buying it after the trial hopefully because it is an amazing product. The only downside is the market needs to get the instagram app and a fee others. Other then that it is amazing. Very high def easy to use especially for.my two and four year old. Love reading books on it and watching movies. It certainly is a must buy product if your looking for a quality tablet

Reviews.Title: Fast break down
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: This is a really good tablet it only has some minor glitches. Some apps you have to be uninstall and re install to use. You can't customize it in pretty much anyway. I mean over all its a good tablet, but its new and the kinks need to be worked out. Its fast really fast. Plays almost all games, except you don't have Google play store that ls a minus. A wonders screen that is a bit overkill but its great. It freezes up for no reason a lot as well. Over ll i gave it gave it four startspros1 fast processoramazing screen3 great internet speeds4 ok speakers5 charges battery to full in less then 4 hours and last ll day longcons1 no customization what so ever2 no Google play store3 sever glitches with apps4. freezes up from time to time and need hard resetover all its good tablet if you have the money i would recommend buying it if you want a kindle.

Reviews.Title: The Tablet to buy
Reviews.Author: srinivasan ramanan
Reviews.Content: The perfect tablet with the power of Amazon. Needed to work on some issues like e-mail and flash player otherwise this is as good as it gets. I also think that with upgrades to the OS coming this should get better and better.ThanksSrini

Reviews.Title: This is the best
Reviews.Author: Joanne Odom "-Odom"
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is the perfect size.  It has everything that I need.  I love the display layout.  I have the total package.

Reviews.Title: awsome product
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I heard a few rumors about screen issues, but I bought 2 and use them daily for hours on end watching streaming and shopping and have not had a single issue.  So far it is faster, runs smoother and 0 hiccups it runs better than my high dollar gaming computer.  Definitely blows iPad out of the water hands down, and runs better than some of the other competitors.  The free live visual tech support for any questions comes in handy also.

Reviews.Title: This product ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: Kit
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift and am over the top pleased! I have a First Generation iPad that is worn out and acting up on me and I wanted a new tablet. I LOVE THIS! It is lightweight and thin and fits in even my small purses. The screen is crisp and clear and there isn't a lag or delay like there is with iPads. My movies, books and music downloaded without a problem. This is exactly what I was expecting and what I was wanting. I enjoyed my iPad while it lasted, but I will never go back. The functionality of the Kindle Fire just shuts down iPad. Battery lasts long and recharges quickly. There are a few games that cause it to drain quickly but that is to be expected from the larger storage games. Do not hesitate to purchase this if it has caught your interest.

Reviews.Title: killer just killer
Reviews.Author: Jeremy R Redmond
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HDX 8.9 is the killer of all tablets including iPad. I own an iPad mini and I would easily choose this. This does everything you want it to its honestly the best table on the market

Reviews.Title: The iPad mini takes a beating.
Reviews.Author: Ruiz
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HDX - Two week reviewThe tablet has become an entertainment device for the children. The Free Amazon App of the Day has only encouraged this situation. I find it strange that the younger ones rather watch Netflix on the tablet than on the television. I think it is because the image is actually bigger than the screen appears from the couch.The tablet works well as a chant/music e-reader. It is light enough to hold during an entire practice or Mass, and there is enough bezel to do so with one hand and not mistakenly 'flip' the page. The other hand is needed for my lame attempt at chironomy. The ability to digitally draw markings on the music is also a plus (use the free Adobe Reader). It also works well as a regular e-reader for the same reasons listed.I have yet to become that person that can "do anything" on a tablet and rarely uses the laptop. That day may never come. The keyboard and mouse have spoiled me, and the quick email-fb check is easier and more practical on the handy smartphone. I do, however, appreciate the occasional quicker web search when the two laptops are in use.I sideloaded Flash onto it and felt content. However, I have yet to use it for anything Flash related. Go figure.I have no iPad related regrets. The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is most comparable to the iPad mini (same width in portrait mode), yet it is lighter (good for one hand e-reading), has a brighter screen for outdoor viewing, is less expensive (good for the wallet), and offers up great free apps of the day (some apps that normally retail for $7 at the Amazon and Apple App Stores).So if you are looking for an alternative to the iPad mini, take a hard look at the HDX 8.9.

Reviews.Title: much improved
Reviews.Author: Dana G. Cook
Reviews.Content: I bought a iPad air and kindle fire hdx. I couldn't make up my mind so I bought both and tested them out. They are both great devices but I think the HDX is better for more people. Every app I wanted was available on the HDX. I had to load some apps, such as Next Issue, directly from web sites but the system works perfectly.  As a previous kindle and iPad owner, I always preferred the iPad web browser over silk. That is no longer the case. I had constant issues with the iPad browser and it didn't work with my bank's advanced features that I use such as person to person payments. The Amazon browser is much more stable and the reading view is awesome.  I have always felt that my iPad was more suited for access to apps and my fire for all things content related. Going forward, I don't see a need to own both. The fire HDX is superior for all things content related as it has been in the past, but with improved browsing, more apps, app switching and the mayday button this device is all I need.Superb product Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Purchase
Reviews.Author: R. Coleman
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HDX for myself intending simply to have a great storage system for technical books, etc. so that I could use it while learning Linux on my desktop since it is so much easier to have a tablet open in front of you for research while practicing using text editors, file management, etc. than to have an actual book. I love it for this purpose, but fell in love with all the other goodies that tablets have- such as streaming videos, movies, music, and so on. This thing really is spoiling me, as I never really use my desktop for media consumption- it's great to just reach out and grab this thing when having a sleepless  night; there is always something to do on the Kindle besides tossing and turning! So glad I finally made the move to Kindle and really, really love my Amazon Prime subscription...

Reviews.Title: LOVE!!!
Reviews.Author: mccool
Reviews.Content: I was only buying this to read my textbooks on but I have found so many more uses for it than just a book reader and I can't keep my kids off the apps n games. One of my son's who hates to read will read on the kindle.  Reading is reading however he does it thanks!!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, only small design issues that don't impact overall experience.
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: LOVE!I really enjoy using this product.My only negative feedback so far is that when you plug the tablet in... the connection will eventually break the way that most phones break. There isn't enough structure/reinforcement around the outlet and power cord, and the location of it is such that it will have pressure on it over time and eventually loosen the connection and probably need to be repaired. Its is a problem I've had with a lot of phones too.The tablet itself performs very well, is lightweight and thin, and displays excellently. I'm not in love with the volume control and power buttons on the back of the tablet rather than on the sides, but I can live with it.The "special offers" enhancement is very non-invasive and totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: Hot Product
Reviews.Author: NancyEM
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure which tablet to buy since there are so many on the market.  Decided on the Kindle HDX and I LOVE it.  It is as good as a laptop only smaller.  I can do anything on it and take it everywhere! Vibrant colors and watching movies on it is exceptional.  GREAT PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: I'm having fun with it, althouth I bought it for professional reasons,
Reviews.Author: tttiger "Tinctoris"
Reviews.Content: that is, in order to display my photography in art class, there to be transformed into paintings. The camera is 8mp and much better than the Ipad. I should state that I began my journey with an Ipad Air, only to be disappointed at its contrariness and mediocre 5mp camera. While I haven't used the flash on the Fire, it's good to know it's there when I need it. I find steadying the tablet camera very easy with the Fire, which is something I worried about. I see no difference in the weight between this and the Air, which I returned. I find navigating from screen to screen easy--very intuitive. The picture is bright and clear as a bell. While I don't use the audio much, the speakers are good. I find exploring the web a bit cumbersome with Silk (the browser), but quite do-able. I have called for Mayday assistance three times, and had my questions answered quickly and professionally each time. Amazon has built a good product, and the support behind it is unmatched in the market. Go buy one.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect.
Reviews.Author: anncat
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle.  I purchased this particular model to have the unit serve as a portable laptop in addition to being my e-reader.  I would give it  5 stars if I could figure out a way to lock the screen orientation.  I even purchased an app and it doesn't work.  I'm still looking for a suitable cover that serves as an easel.  The one I purchased has a nice notched base-plate, but the back (easel part) is not stiff, so I am unable to set the Kindle at the angle I prefer for reading at a table.  The Kindle slowly tips backwards as the easel relaxes and bends from the weight of the Kindle.As a laptop/notebook computer, this is faster by far than my PC, which isn't the latest or fastest.  I use it primarily for downloading e-mail and doing internet searches.  Using this as a reader, I'm still reading a minimum of 2 books per week and am impatiently waiting for the next books in several series to be published.
